note.p: Burial: Tichmarsh, Northamptonshire, England, Europe (28 September 1701)
Career: Deputy Treasurer of the Fleet (1660); Secretary to the Commissioners for Tangier, who administered the short lived British ruled colony in Tangier (1662-1669)
Committee appointments include: Committee for the Histories of Trades (1664)
Other RSActivity: Proposed on 9 December 1663 and was admitted on the same day he was elected.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; ODNB
References: E N da C Andrade, 'Samuel Pepys and the Royal Society' in NR 1963 vol 18 pp 82-93
Notes: Last appears in 1699 PL. In DNB under Elizabeth Creed
